title: Lemongrass and Garlic Shrimp
summary: Lemongrass and Garlic Shrimp might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 4 and costs $4.94 per serving. One serving contains 373 calories, 47g of protein, and 14g of fat. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. If you have canolan oil, jumbo tiger shrimp, lemongrass stalk, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the sugar you could follow this main course with the Whole Wheat Refined Sugar Free Sugar Cookies as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 48%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Trying Something New: Shrimp with Lemongrass, Lemongrass Shrimp, and Lemongrass Shrimp Salad.
instructions: Combine 1/4 cup sugar, canola oil, fish sauce, chopped lemongrass, and grated garlic in a food processor or mini chopper; process until the lemongrass is finely chopped. Transfer sugar mixture to a large zip-top plastic bag. Add shrimp; seal and marinate in refrigerator 45 minutes.                                                                                                 Prepare grill to high heat.                                                                                                 Remove shrimp from bag; discard marinade. Thread 6 shrimp onto each of 6 (12-inch) skewers. Place skewers on grill rack; grill 2 minutes on each side or until done.

steps.step: Combine 1/4 cup sugar, canola oil, fish sauce, chopped lemongrass, and grated garlic in a food processor or mini chopper; process until the lemongrass is finely chopped.
Transfer sugar mixture to a large zip-top plastic bag.
Add shrimp; seal and marinate in refrigerator 45 minutes.
Remove shrimp from bag; discard marinade. Thread 6 shrimp onto each of 6 (12-inch) skewers.
Place skewers on grill rack; grill 2 minutes on each side or until done.
